Before COP30 in Belém, heads of state defend collective climate action against 'extremist forces'
subhead: The climate action summit bringing together around 60 world leaders in Belém, Brazil, opened in a somber atmosphere on November 6 and 7, with no representatives from the United States or India in attendance.

Shein: France considers new tax on small packages as latest weapon against Chinese online retailers
subhead: The French government plans to introduce a €2 levy on every item arriving from a non-European country, with lawmakers set to debate the proposal from November 12. France would be the first country to create such a tax, a measure that has already sparked controversy.

title: US submits draft resolution to UN Security Council for international force in Gaza
subhead: The US administration seeks to incorporate this element of its peace plan within the framework of the United Nations. The draft calls for a presence until December 31, 2027, renewable and under the oversight of a committee chaired by Donald Trump.

title: Belgium faces security crisis as daily drone overflights spark alarm
subhead: The National Security Council met on Thursday to address a wave of aerial incursions, which have targeted military bases and airports across the country. The heightened tensions come amid political turmoil, as the prime minister struggles to pass a budget.

title: Marlene Dumas becomes first contemporary woman artist to join the Louvre's permanent collection
subhead: She has exhibited her work in the world's most prestigious museums and her paintings have broken auction records. The Dutch-South African painter has created a body of work shaped by the traumas of her time. At 72, she joins the Louvre with a series of nine portraits. This event illustrates the shift sought by Louvre Director Laurence des Cars, one that she is maintaining even after the institution was the target of a dramatic jewelry heist.

'It's like they're coming out of a cult': Ukraine tackles Russian indoctrination of repatriated children
subhead: To date, 1,762 Ukrainian children have been repatriated after being forcibly transferred by Moscow. Ukrainians are working to de-indoctrinate them and are warning that today, all children living under occupation, Russified and militarized, are being torn from their country without even having to be physically deported.

title: War in Ukraine: Battle for Pokrovsk enters final phase
subhead: Russian infantry are advancing inside the city, one of the last major urban centers in the Donetsk region still under Kyiv's control. Moscow's shift in tactics – focusing on destroying Ukrainian logistics – has paid off after six months.

title: The posthumous fall of Hermann Gmeiner, Austria's 'national hero' and founder of SOS Children's Villages
subhead: The founder of the well-known non-profit organization who died in 1986 is at the center of revelations about 'sexual abuse' and 'physical violence.' Across Austria, streets and schools bearing his name are being renamed, and statues of him are being removed.
